page.title: 11A Visit to Mr Crisp
page.content: Mr Crisp was born in Saxmundham in Crisps shop in 1908.He went to school opposite Saxmundham primary school.He could remember the main road before 1914. In the winter the main road was muddy and like a track . In the summer it was very dusty . He could remember when his well water was condemned and he had to go to the town square to fetch the water.He remembered both of the world wars.They cooked on stoves and they lit with wood and paper. He said there were fewer varieties of sweets when he was a boy.They could buy an amount of sweets with 1\2p but a mans wages were 2 pounds a week.Many more people used bicycles and he remembers the days of the horse and trap.
